Enerio, Jr. | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | elevation_ft = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 16317 | population_as_of = 2000 | population_density_km2 = <!-- auto --> | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = [[Philippine Standard Time|PST]] | utc_offset1 = +8 | postal_code_type = [[List of ZIP codes in the Philippines|ZIP code]] | postal_code = | area_code_type = [[Telephone numbers in the Philippines|Dialing code]] | area_code = | blank_name_sec1 = [[Municipalities of the Philippines#Income classification|Income class]] | blank_info_sec1 = 4th class town | website = | footnotes = }} '''Lakewood''' ([[Filipino Language|Subanen]]:'''''G'benwa Danaw''''') is a 4th class [[Philippine municipality|municipality]] in the [[Philippine province|province]] of [[Zamboanga del Sur province|Zamboanga del Sur]], [[Philippines]]. According to the 2000 census, it has a population of 16,317 people in 3,122 households. Lakewood was named after Lake Wood, a large lake intersecting the town. The most popular species of [[fish]] in the province can only be caught in the lake: the [[carpa]] and [[porang]]. The [[Subanon|Subanen tribe]] is the major ethnic group living in the suburban areas; they cultivate [[vegetable]]s and [[maize|corn]] for their own use. Subanens have their own dialect, but they also speak [[Cebuano language|Cebuano]] as a common dialect for conversation. ==Barangays== Lakewood is politically subdivided into 14 [[barangay]]s. * Bagong Kahayag * Baking * Biswangan * Bululawan * Dagum * Gasa * Gatub * Lukuan * Matalang * Poblacion (Lakewood) * Sapang Pinoles * Sebuguey * Tiwales * Tubod Barangay Tubod is the largest barangay and most populated barangay, serving as a gateway to the town. Its name derives from the Cebuano term ''tubod'' which means "spring". It has a hospital, the Singidas Medical Clinic, which is regarded as the cleanest hospital of the town. The Lily's Hidden Spring in the upper part of Tubod, and Mainit Waterfall in the lower part of Gatub are among Lakewood's tourist attractions. ==External links== *[http://www.nscb.gov.ph/activestats/psgc/default.asp Philippine Standard Geographic Code] *[http://www.census.gov.ph/census2000/index.html 2000 Philippine Census Information] {{Zamboanga del Sur}} [[Category:Municipalities of Zamboanga del Sur]]
